Posts.Content: jeanieB I'm so excited for you, time to crack open a bottle & have a little party Wow I love this site. Where else can baldness, new pubes & beards be discussed so easily. After 3 x3weekly EC I'm now on 4/9 taxol & my head of hair is starting to regrow but v fuzzy & soft. My eyebrows & eyelashes are all slowly giving up the 'comfort' of my body but chinhair (that was being electrolyised into submission preBC has been continuing to reemerge - truly thought that wud see the sense & stop for a while. Have debated making a feature of them... - but my make up skills aren't that good & haven't done my 'look better' day yet; or along with wearing a buff on my head I could wear Over my chinney chin chin ...  well the pubes are long gone still not reemerging yet so I could rock a If it wasn't so cold, I hadn't been ingesting so many steroids & if my picc line was pink to match.  Hang in there everyone there's light at the end of the tunnel x
Posts.Title: New eyelashes- woohoo!

Posts.Content: Of flips hedgewitch I now have image of exploding tank .... my thoughts were to just let it go till January once my chemo waste will have passed thru then mayb get it emptied & start a fresh .... My thought for Alwaysbaking's question Hedgewitch is hope your veggie patch isn't too near your soakaway Thx for advice xx
Posts.Title: Septic tank & effect of chemo on it .... random but ....

Posts.Content: Dear All Thanks for septic tank reassurance! I'll just keep on supping water & flushing the loo!! Xx
Posts.Title: Septic tank & effect of chemo on it .... random but ....

Posts.Content: We live pretty much in the middle of nowhere so have a septic tank for all waste water. Has anyone any experience/knowledge of the effect chemo has on the 'happy' bacteria in the tank? Thx Vicki
Posts.Title: Septic tank & effect of chemo on it .... random but ....

Posts.Content: Can they prescribe different pain relief? I found codeine phosphate did nothing but dihydrocodiene works best for me. Just a thought?  It will ease tho with every week that passes Good luck x
Posts.Title: Numbness and nerve pain after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi Go for a picc line best advice I ever got. I had a temporary problem with mine which meant round 2 of EC had to b done thru a cannula - that round I suffered a very painful achey vein that has since kept 'popping' back to remind me (now 7 weeks since). Picc line then started working again & hey ho it's a doddle! U can get a plastic limbo sleeve via GP to put over the site so u can have lovely hot showers.  Take care Vicki x
Posts.Title: Chemo every week for 12 weeks Taxol

Posts.Content: That was useful. I had forgotten all about pink EC pee til I was looking at the colour chart.
Posts.Title: Ideal amount of water

Posts.Content: Hi after only drinking coffee for years I started drinking hot water in pint glasses to drink enough water when breast feeding my children. A habit I've continued. When having my 3weekly ec & 9 x t I aimed to stink 3li the day before & day of treatment then abt 2li ish on a normal day. I found the only time I didn't do the 3li I felt terrible so do think it helps yo combat that dehydrated/chemo hangover. I aim at the pint glass approach st each meal. And then weakened fruit juice or squash to help get the intake up. Plus limited myself to only 2 large cups of coffee (or tea) each day.  My body seemed to need the loo a lot in the beginning but then it seems to stabilise.  Good luck you won't turn into a   Or   Xx
Posts.Title: Ideal amount of water

Posts.Content: Dear Kate I'd definitely recommend taking someone with you -  my hubby came with me & waited patiently in main waiting room when he wasn't allowed with me - I then rejoined him until I was called to next 'test'.  Re Carolyn's 'boob job' some nurses (but not many) have a v low sense of humour. As a family we named my lump 'Bob'; any Lil tumor cells that may have escaped 'Bobbettes'; DCIS - embryonic Bobs & then when I was told I'd need a mastectomy (not at all what I expected) we named it Racquel (after kenny Everett sketch). As a family it meant we could discuss the whole thing any where at any time (my children are 16yr girl & 13 yr boy).  My advice be kind to yourself this weekend. These forums are great for picking up lots of useful advice. Good luck for Monday.  X
Posts.Title: One stop breast clinic

Posts.Content: You are being v brave, strong & patient. Well done. The system is now working. Will be thinking of you tomorrow. X
Posts.Title: One stop breast clinic

Posts.Content: I find yhis really helped me & it's really gentle. 8 floz water 1/4 teaspoon baking soda (bicarbonate) 1/4 teaspoon salt. I used boiled water added dry stuff stirred to dissolve. Once cooled I kept in a small water bottle with a sports cap on in bathroom. Then I could squirt in as little or as much as I needed.  Then in more severe instances when I became lax with the above I had to resort to Difflam Good luck
Posts.Title: Recipe for mouthwask

Posts.Content: My BCN said to not shave node removal side in case of nick/cut. I'm waiting for the positive SE of chemo to remove the need for hair removal! (Silver lining & all that).
Posts.Title: Underarm Waxing

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone reacts differently so cross your fingers & hope!   I found all the chemo/oncol team at York to b brilliant. I had a fairly swift reaction to epirubicin (they said that was v unusually). They dealt with it very calmly & v proactively. Lots of antihistamine. They tried to improve any se I had from ulcers to upset stomachs to dressings covering my picc line. Then changed my docetaxel to pacletaxel to be easier/kinder to my body. Just speak to the nurses & your oncol.  Food allergies are a nightmare at the best of times (both my children have medically confirmed different alkergies) & the chemo does affect the digestive tract I still have to avoid dairy so just take it steady & see where you get to.  Good luck, the time will pass but pace yourself.  X
Posts.Title: Multiple food intolerances and chemotherapy

Posts.Content: Dear Jilly That's pants! I'm sorry.  Re the dog ears my surgeons said they could be corrected in the future as part of my tidy up once everything had settled. So I'd mention it to them when you see them next.  I thought I had a hernia but transpired it was my 'natural tissue store' where the internal diep surgery has finished/stopped. They have since liposuctioned it out.  I'd chat it through with your surgeons.  Good luck X
Posts.Title: Diep hernia?

Posts.Content: I too am now a Liz Earle devotee hot cloth / moisturiser etc. Often have great deals online.  A kind friend gave me fab pot of L'occitane Creme Masque - apparently I'm meant to wash it off after 5 mins but I put a small amount on just before sleeping mayb 1 or twice a week - also good for my chemo head/scalp.  Also have  argan oil that use on my hands & cuticles from time to time between using an opi hand cream.  Oooo just remembered my mum used Aveeno cream during her cancer treatments - made from oats v gentle Good luck.  Vicki
Posts.Title: Looking for a good light (thin) Moisturiser ?
